input_text:
Job Title: Mortgage Loan Closer

Location: Tampa, FL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
When joining USF Federal Credit Union, you can expect to work for a company that: 

Strives to be the most influential partner in our Members’ financial journey.Has been recognized with awards such as the “Sterling Governor’s Award for Excellence” and League of Southern Credit Unions & Affiliates “Credit Union of the Year”.Has a culture of engagement, growth, process improvement and community volunteerism.

What’s In It For You

Competitive pay, robust incentive programs, 401k matching, Mortgage and Auto Loan discounts4 weeks minimum paid time off work, work anniversary paid time off, 11 paid holidays and 8 hours paid volunteer time off.Medical, Dental and vision plans with FSA option. (Employee Only Premiums for Dental and Vision are 100% Credit Union covered).100% Credit Union Paid Short-Term and Long-Term Disability and Life InsuranceEmployee Assistance ProgramUndergraduate and Graduate Tuition ReimbursementIn-depth New Employee Orientation showcasing Credit Union Values and VisionA Think Big culture dedicated to performance excellence and continual growth

Position Summary

The Mortgage Loan Closer/Funder is responsible for the closing and funding process including preparation of the closing coordination, preparation of the initial closing disclosure, closing document preparation, and funding of mortgage loans. They are responsible for completing missing or correcting erroneous data as well as reviewing info submitted by the loan officer. Ensure loans are documented and closed in accordance with the credit approval. Well-versed in TRID guidelines and regulatory requirements. Maintains a positive attitude and conducts business in a professional manner. Assures that all members, staff, and visitors are treated with consideration and respect and is responsible for meeting production levels set by USF Federal Credit Union.

Essential Functions Include

Accurately prepare closing disclosures, closing documents and fund mortgage loans including home equity lines of credit. Effectively communicate with members, vendors, internal contacts, and external contacts in a positive, and assertive manner to make sure all required deadlines are met and deliver regular status reports requests. Contact members to explain the closing process and request additional documentation as needed.Prioritize and monitor daily workflow to ensure all loans are being worked in accordance with company's timeline expectations. Monitors loan status to ensure that time/quality standards are met.Performs pre-closing quality review of loan files prior to releasing closing documents.Perform other related duties as assigned.

Reports To

Mortgage Operations Manager

Required Education And Experience

A high school education or G.E.D.A minimum of 2 years’ closing experienceExcellent oral and written communication skills.Aptitude to learn quickly and solve problems.Ability to work collaboratively with others in a fast paced, deadline driven, team environment typical to mortgage lending.Knowledge of mortgage lending criteria, compliance, federal/state regulations

Additional Skills

Must have a high level of organizational skills, analytical skills and be able to multitaskProficient with standard computer applications including Microsoft Office.

Work Environment

Hybrid work environment – one day in-office per week

Physical Requirements

Sitting frequently, walking occasionally, use of hands frequently, walking occasionally, use of hands frequently, hearing constantly, talking frequently, exerting up to 10lbs of force occasionally to life, carry, push, pull, or move objects.

Position Type/Expected Hours Of Work

Full-Time/40 hours per week

Classification

Non-Exempt

Other Duties

Please note this job description is not a comprehensive list of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required in this position. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

About Us

For 65 years, USF FCU has experienced rapid growth and is dedicated to delivering financial solutions to improve our members’ lives. Our success is thrilling, but our core values of excellence, passion, innovation, community, and collaboration mean our relationships with our members and our employees will always be our top priority! We have grown to over 73,000 members and $1.1 billion in assets, robust online and mobile banking, 9 branch locations and thousands of shared branches and fee-free ATMs nationwide.

Our vision is to be the most influential partner in each member’s financial journey.

Our mission is to deliver financial solutions to improve members’ lives.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level

output_json.summary: USF Federal Credit Union seeks a Mortgage Loan Closer with experience in finance and sales.
